title: Honkai: Star Rail Tier List
description: Discover the latest Honkai: Star Rail Tier List as of April 2025. Find out which characters rank in S, A, B, and C tiers to optimize your team composition.
heading: Honkai: Star Rail Tier List
introText: Discover the latest Honkai: Star Rail Tier List as of April 2025. Find out which characters rank in S, A, B, and C tiers to optimize your team composition.

data.itemDescription: Grants team-wide shields, buffs follow-up attacks and Crit stats, making him a top-tier sustain with bonus damage potential
Enables universal Toughness reduction and Super Break Damage, making her essential for Break-focused teams
Absorbs damage for allies and self-heals below 50% HP, acting as a durable and reliable tank
A powerful healer with Break potential, follow-up damage, and healing that feels like an added bonus
Boosts the entire team's damage, Crit stats, and turn order, making her an elite all-around support
Increases team damage, Break Effect, and Speed while delaying enemy recovery, perfect for high-efficiency buffs
Provides extra Skill Points, boosts team damage, and accelerates turns, excelling in flexible team comps
Combines buffs, cleansing, and summon synergy for massive Crit and utility, making him one of the most versatile supports
Enhances follow-up attack teams with her own FUA damage and summon synergy, a must-have for FUA comps
Offers Resistance Penetration, follow-up triggers, and solid personal damage, fitting well into most teams
A powerful DPS character who excels in dealing high damage and can fit into various team compositions
A character with balanced offensive and defensive capabilities, suitable for diverse team setups
Grants an ally an immediate turn and buffs team Crit and Attack, making her one of the best supports in the game
A powerful single-target DPS who excels in follow-up attack teams thanks to her passive
Dominates the Super Break meta with massive damage during her Ultimate and implanted Fire Weakness
Heals and regenerates Energy for allies while boosting Attack, blending Abundance with Harmony support
Specializes in boosting DoT damage and synergizes best with other DoT-inflicting teammates
A passive healer who restores health through attacks and dispels enemy buffs, scaling off his own Attack
Reduces enemy defense and generates Energy, making her a strong Ice support for AoE-focused teams
Deals strong AoE Break Damage and Super Break, perfect for teams targeting many enemies in Pure Fiction
Boosts Crit Damage and team turn speed, a great free support option
Strong AoE attacker with bonus effects when paired with Erudition allies, excels against multiple enemies
Buffs an ally’s Attack and restores Energy, a versatile 4-star support for high DPS characters
Enables Super Break Damage while enemies are Weakness Broken, and works well as a free buffer
A competent character with abilities that allow for strategic plays and synergy with various team compositions
Offers solid area-of-effect damage, making him effective against groups of enemies
A character with reliable single-target damage, suitable for boss encounters
A durable damage dealer who can sustain himself in prolonged battles
Provides utility through debuffs and can adapt to various combat situations
A versatile character capable of fulfilling multiple roles depending on team needs
Known for her consistent damage output and reliability in various scenarios
A strong single-target DPS who implants Physical Weakness and quickly reduces Toughness
A healer with surprisingly good damage, who also boosts team Break Damage and debuffs enemies
Generates Skill Points and buffs damage and speed, ideal for Skill-hungry DPS teams
AoE Fire nuker who triggers follow-ups when enemies are broken, great against waves of enemies
Applies team-wide Quantum damage and unleashes powerful follow-ups by charging attacks through an ally
Heals and redirects enemy aggro to tanky allies, while cleansing debuffs with her Ultimate
Versatile free support and sub-DPS who enhances allies and deals conditional Toughness or Crit damage
A follow-up attacker who supports with Prey marks, improving at higher Eidolons
RNG-dependent Quantum DPS who becomes powerful at E6 through tile matching mechanics
Quantum assassin who can chain multiple turns via resets, making her deadly in multi-target fights
Randomly implants weaknesses and debuffs enemies, perfect for teams lacking elemental coverage
Reduces enemy speed and turn frequency, giving your team more chances to act
A Physical tank-DPS hybrid who taunts enemies and counters while self-healing and regenerating Energy
A character who, with proper investment, can perform well but may require specific team setups
Offers defensive utility and can protect teammates effectively
Asta boosts the whole team’s speed with her Ultimate, potentially granting extra turns that can turn the tide of battle
Bailu heals multiple allies and can revive one fallen teammate per battle, making her a top-tier healer, though she can’t cleanse debuffs
Gepard provides strong team shields with his Ultimate and can revive once per battle, excelling in fights with fewer enemies
Xueyi’s Ultimate bypasses enemy weaknesses, always reducing Toughness and making her a versatile damage dealer
Yukong buffs allies’ ATK, Crit Rate, and Crit DMG, but requires careful timing to keep Roaring Bowstrings active
Guinaifen inflicts Burn DoTs and increases enemy damage taken, making her perfect with Kafka
Herta deals strong AOE Ice damage and follows up attacks when enemies drop below a certain HP threshold, great for Pure Fiction
Luka causes Bleed, debuffs enemies, and dispels buffs, making him useful in low-target fights
Misha works best as a sub-DPS in teams that use lots of Skill Points and benefit from Freeze synergy
Natasha is a reliable healer who also removes debuffs, ideal for early game and long fights
Sampo applies AOE Wind DoTs and slows enemies, shining when paired with Kafka
Serval deals AOE Lightning damage and shocks enemies, simple but effective early on
Sushang gains extra turns and excels against Physical-weak enemies, especially in single-target battles
Fire Trailblazer is a strong tank who draws aggro and deals decent Fire damage
Yanqing can freeze enemies and deal solid Ice damage, but he’s unreliable compared to other DPS
Arlan doesn’t use Skill Points and frees them for others, but costs HP with every Skill use
Dan Heng is a solid single-target Wind DPS, good for story and early content
Hook deals fast Fire damage and inflicts Burn, but gets outclassed by better Fire units
Physical Trailblazer is a basic but durable AoE and single-target Physical damage dealer
